article.headline: UTEP 71, Louisiana Tech 68
article.story: EL PASO, Texas (AP) -- Fili Rivera hit two free throws with eight seconds left to help Texas-El Paso preserve a 71-68 victory over Louisiana Tech on Saturday night. Louisiana Tech had one last chance, but Donell Allick's 3-pointer bounced off the rim at the buzzer. UTEP (15-4, 6-3 Western Athletic) led 66-54 with 5:12 left before Louisiana Tech (10-9, 4-5) rallied. Allick scored five points and Corey Dean scored on a dunk to cap a 14-3 run and pull within 69-68 with 16 seconds left. Gio St. Amant led UTEP with 14 points, Omar Thomas scored 13 points and John Tofi had 12. Rivera and Roy Smallwood added 10 points apiece. JueMichael Young led Louisiana Tech with 17 points. Allick had 14 points and Dean added 13. Paul Milsaps, the Bulldogs' leading scorer and the nation's leading rebounder, had 10 points, nine rebounds and five turnovers. Milsaps, who averages 15.2 points and 12.4 rebounds, sat down with his fourth foul with 13 minutes left and the scored tied 43-43. UTEP took advantage of Milsaps' absence with a 13-5 run. Milsaps fouled out two minutes later.
